name: 高級寫作（一）
restrict: ◎限大三修習◎必須先修過【ENU0287  中級寫作（一）】、【ENU0288  中級寫作（二）】
description: In Advanced Writing, the course aims to integrate writing skills students learned in previous two years with their knowledge of a topic, subject, or theme in order to prepare students for future career. Creative use of different types of essays will be expected to be contextualized in different fields, including exam-related, work-related, or research paper related fields. Language-based writing can also be integrated with different modes of communication, such as pictures, audios, webpages as an individual or group project.
goals: To help students rehearse skills in various modes of writing
Help students build a good sense of the difference between smart, sophisticated, quality writing and bland, hackneyed writing
Students are expected to integrate writing techniques with their knowledge of the topic/subject
syllabus:
**Course Description**

The first half of this yearlong course focuses on practical writing. In particular, students will gain experience in writing various types of business letters (e.g., cover letter, sales letter, advice letter, PR apology letter, travel letter) as well as personal statement for graduate school application. Particular emphasis is on the improvement of essential usage and mechanics skills. 

Spring semester (preview): The second half of the course aims to help students write and think critically about contemporary social issues. Students will read selected works and develop argumentative essay writing skills. Through in-class discussions and activities, as well as individual consultations with the instructor, the course provides the practice students need in honing essential critical thinking and writing skills.

**Required Text**

Handouts provided by the instructor.

(Optional) Ritch Sorenson, Grace DeBord and Ida Ramirez, _Business and Management Communication_. Available at Crane Bookstore.

**Course requirements**

Eight types of business letters + portfolio (total: 50%) 

GS personal statement & activity (10%)

Two Quizzes (15% each)

\--The quizzes will cover grammar, usage and other writing tips as reviewed in class.

Participation & In-class activities (10%)

**Attendance Policy**

Regular class attendance is vital to academic success. _If_ for any reason _you cannot attend_ _a_ _class_ _session,_ _please_ _inform the instructor with a short email beforehand._

**On Plagiarism and Cheating**

_Plagiarism_ is a **SERIOUS CRIME** and will thus be treated seriously. Refer to the NTNU Handbook for policy and disciplinary actions on plagiarism and cheating.

**Course Schedule**

Week 1: Course Overview; Preliminaries

Week 2 & 3: Resume, Cover Letter, Post-Int. Letter, Editing Exercise

Week 4: Notes on Usage & Convention I; Writing Ex.

Week 5: Sales/Persuasive Letter  

Week 6: Commonly Confused Words; Editing Exercise

Week 7: Company Welcome Letter

Week 8: Notes on Usage & Convention II; Writing Ex.

Week 9: Quiz I; Extra Consultations

Week 10: No Class (Sports Day)

Week 11 & 12: Advice Letter; PR Apology Letter; Travel Letter

Week 13: Notes on Usage & Convention III; Writing Ex.

Week 14 & 15: GS Personal Statement; Study Goals

Week 16: Editing Exercise; Portfolios

Week 17: Quiz 2; Extra Consultations
